titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Guy Jean Pauker Papers, 1928-1996
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2000 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 271 manuscript boxes, 34 card file boxes, 1 oversize box, 5 envelopes, 10 slide boxes, 35 microfilm reels, 1 motion picture film reel

did.abstract: Studies, reports, memoranda, notes, correspondence, trial transcripts, bulletins, press summaries, clippings, and printed matter, relating to political, social, and economic conditions in Indonesia; Indonesian foreign relations, especially with the United States; communism in Indonesia; the coup of 1965 in Indonesia, and trials in its aftermath; and education in Indonesia.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Guy Jean Pauker Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1982.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Studies, reports, memoranda, notes, correspondence, trial transcripts, bulletins, press summaries, clippings, and printed matter, relating to political, social, and economic conditions in Indonesia; Indonesian foreign relations, especially with the United States; communism in Indonesia; the coup of 1965 in Indonesia, and trials in its aftermath; and education in Indonesia.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: American political scientist; senior staff member, Rand Corporation, 1960-

chronitem.event: Lic es lett, University of Bucharest
Lic en droit, University of Bucharest
Research associate, Massachussetts Institute of Technology
co-author, Comparative Politics of Non-Western Countries
Assistant professor, political science, University of California, Berkeley
author, Indonesian Images of Their National Self
author, Southeast Asia As a Problem Area in the Next Decade
Associate professor, political science, University of California, Berkeley
Senior staff member, Rand Corporations, Social Science Department
contributor, The Role of the Military in Indonesia
Research associate, Environmental Quality Lab, California, Institute of Technology
co-author, Smog: A Report to the Peoples

scopecontent.p: Card files listing research notes, biographical information, excerpts and citations from published sources pertaining to Indonesia arranged chronologically and alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Trials, hearings and verdicts of participants in the 30 September 1965 coup
145 prints depicting scenes, events and people in Indonesia, Thailand and other Southeast Asian countries,

scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by title of contents.

did.unittitle: ANETA General News and Telegraph Agency, Economic News Report, 1954-56
Miscellaneous excerpts from the Indonesian press and other sources pertaining to Indonesia
Film of interview with D. Aidit and Sukarno, January 1959.

scopecontent.p: This addition to the collection has not yet been described. Please let the Hoover Institution Archives know if you would like to see this material described. Contact us at hooverarchivesinfo@stanford.edu
